get.description: Returns a list of your organization's <<glossary:account>>(s).

parameters.description: Account ID for cursor pagination
parameters.name: page[before]

parameters.description: Account ID for cursor pagination
parameters.name: page[after]

parameters.description: Limit on the number of accounts returned
parameters.name: page[size]

parameters.description: Filter accounts by reference ID
parameters.name: filter[reference-id]

post.description:
Creates a new Account for your organization.

After the Account is created, you can create Inquiries with the `account-id` to attach the Inquiry to it.

address-city.description: City of residence address. Not all international addresses use this attribute.

address-postal-code.description: ZIP or postal code of residence address. Not all international addresses use this attribute.

address-street-2.description: Extension of residence address, usually apartment or suite number.

address-subdivision.description: State or subdivision of residence address. In the US, this should be the unabbreviated name. Not all international addresses use this attribute.

birthdate.description: Birthdate, must be in the format "YYYY-MM-DD".

country-code.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha 2 country code of the government ID to be verified. This is generally their country of residence as well.

reference-id.description: Reference ID on Account, refers to an entity in your user model

data.description: Selfie photo data, must be an image. Can also be provided as an uploaded file such as with multipart/form-data requests instead of this object.

tags.description: A list of tag names that are associated to an Account.

delete.description:
Permanently deletes personally identifiable information (PII) for an Account and all associated Inquiries, Verifications and Reports. This action cannot be undone. 

This endpoint can be used to comply with privacy regulations such as GDPR / CCPA or to enforce data privacy.

Note: An account is still updatable after redaction. If you want to delete data continuously, please reach out to us to help you setup a retention policy.

get.description: Retrieve the details of an Account that has previously been created.

address-city.description: City of residence address. Not all international addresses use this attribute.

address-postal-code.description: ZIP or postal code of residence address. Not all international addresses use this attribute.

address-street-2.description: Extension of residence address, usually apartment or suite number.

address-subdivision.description: State or subdivision of residence address. In the US, this should be the unabbreviated name. Not all international addresses use this attribute.

birthdate.description: Birthdate, must be in the format "YYYY-MM-DD".

country-code.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha 2 country code of the government ID to be verified. This is generally their country of residence as well.

reference-id.description: Reference ID on Account, refers to an entity in your user model.

data.description: Selfie photo data, must be an image. Can also be provided as an uploaded file such as with multipart/form-data requests instead of this object.

tags.description: A list of tag names that are associated to an Account.

post.description: Add a new tag to an Account

Consolidates several source Accounts' information into one target Account. Any Inquiry, Verification, Report and Document associated with the source Account will be transferred over to the destination Account. However, the Account's attributes will not be transferred. After consolidation, you can update the destination Account's attributes using the Account update endpoint.

This endpoint can be used to clean up duplicate Accounts.

Note: A source account can only be consolidated once. Afterwards, the source account will be archived.

parameters.description: Destination Account ID
parameters.name: account-id

source-account-ids.description: A list of Account IDs that need to be consolidated into the destination Account.

post.description: Removes an existing tag from an Account
Set all tags on an Account. Note that this removes any tags that are not provided.

post.description:
Importing accounts allows you to upload a CSV file with each row being a new Account.

The columns we allow are 
* reference_id
* name_first
* name_middle
* name_last
* birthdate
* social_security_number
* tags

Importing list items allows you to upload a CSV file with each row being a new List Item.

The columns we allow are 
* value
* match_type (either 'email_address' or 'domain')

A match_type of 'email_address' will need to match the entire email address of an individual, while a match_type of 'domain' will match on the email address domain of an individual (i.e. all email addresses with domain 'gmail.com').
Importing list items allows you to upload image files with each file being a new List Item. We recommend uploading max 50 images (with average image size of 500KB) at a time.

code-samples.name: application/json

code-samples.code:
API_KEY=YOUR_API_KEY_HERE
LIST_ID=YOUR_LIST_ID_HERE
IMAGE1_PATH=IMAGE1_FILE_PATH
IMAGE2_PATH=IMAGE2_FILE_PATH

curl -H "Authorization: Bearer $API_KEY" \
 -F "data[attributes][list-id]=$LIST_ID" \
 -F "data[attributes][image-files][]=@$IMAGE1_PATH" \
 -F "data[attributes][image-files][]=@$IMAGE2_PATH" \
 https://withpersona.com/api/v1/importer/list-item/faces
code-samples.name: multipart/form-data

post.description:
Importing list items allows you to upload a CSV file with each row being a new List Item.

The columns we allow are 
* latitude
* longitude
* radius_meters

Importing list items allows you to upload a CSV file with each row being a new List Item.

The columns we allow are 
* id_number
* id_class

Common values for id_class include 'pp' for passport and 'dl' for driver license. Please contact us or reach out to support@withpersona.com if you need help getting id_class values!

Importing list items allows you to upload a CSV file with each row being a new List Item.

The columns we allow are 
* value

Both IPv4 and IPv6 are supported.

Importing list items allows you to upload a CSV file with each row being a new List Item.

The columns we allow are 
* name_first
* name_last

Importing list items allows you to upload a CSV file with each row being a new List Item.

The columns we allow are 
* value

post.description:
Create a new inquiry with optional pre-filled attributes. 

See [Sessions](doc:inquiry-sessions) for how to continue the inquiry in [Embedded Flow](doc:embedded-flow) or [Hosted Flow](doc:hosted-flow).

account-id.description: Account ID for re-verifications or secure storage

country-code.description: Country code of residence for verification, in ISO 3166 Alpha-2 format.

fields.description:
JSON key-value pairs of field name to field value.

Common fields include
  • `name-first`
  • `name-last`
  • `birthdate`
  • `address-street-1`
  • `address-city`
  • `address-subdivision`
  • `address-postal-code`
  • `address-country-code`
  • `phone-number`
  • `email-address`

inquiry-template-id.description: Template ID for flow requirements (use this field if your template ID starts with `itmpl_`). *You must pass in either template-id OR inquiry-template-id OR inquiry-template-version-id*

inquiry-template-version-id.description: Template Version ID for flow requirements (begins with `itmplv_`). *You must pass in either template-id OR inquiry-template-id OR inquiry-template-version-id*

note.description: Unstructured field for your custom use

redirect-uri.description: If using the Hosted flow, redirect to this URL after completion

reference-id.description: Reference ID on Account, refers to an entity in your user model

template-id.description: Template ID for flow requirements (use this field if your template ID starts with `tmpl_`). *You must pass in either template-id OR inquiry-template-id OR inquiry-template-version-id*

delete.description:
Permanently deletes personally identifiable information (PII) for an Inquiry and all associated Verifications and Reports. This action cannot be undone. 

This endpoint can be used to comply with privacy regulations such as GDPR / CCPA or to enforce data privacy.

get.description:
Retrieves the details of an inquiry that has previously been created.

In the [Embedded Flow](doc:embedded-flow), the `inquiry-id` is the first parameter of the onStart callback. In the [Hosted Flow](doc:hosted-flow), the `inquiry-id` is a query parameter in the onComplete callback.

Template information will be found in `data.relationships.inquiry-template` if the inquiry is a Dynamic Flow inquiry, and in `data.relationships.template` if the inquiry is a Legacy 2.0 inquiry. For more information, see [Dynamic Flow vs. Legacy Templates](doc:inquiry-templates#dynamic-flow-vs-legacy-templates).

post.description: Add a new tag to the Inquiry

Approves an <<glossary:inquiry>>.

Note that this action will trigger any associated workflows and webhooks.

Declines an <<glossary:inquiry>>.

Note that this action will trigger any associated workflows and webhooks.

Expires an inquiry and all sessions on the inquiry. Cancels any pending verifications on the inquiry.

The inquiry can still be resumed after expiry.
Creates a new inquiry session and returns `meta.one-time-link`.

parameters.description: Inquiry ID (starts with "inq_")
parameters.name: inquiry-id

expires_in_seconds.description: Number of seconds from now to expire the key (minimum 0)

get.description: Prints an inquiry as PDF.

post.description: Remove an existing tag from an Inquiry

Creates a new inquiry session and returns `meta.session-token`. If the inquiry's status is `expired`, changes the status to `pending`. The `session-token` must be included when loading the inquiry flow if the inquiry's status is `pending`. For more information, see [Resuming Inquiries](https://docs.withpersona.com/docs/inquiries-resuming-inquiries).
Set all tags on an Inquiry. Note that this removes any tags that are not provided.

parameters.description: ID of the transaction to add tag on.

post.description: Create a new label for an existing <<glossary:transaction>>.

parameters.name: transaction-id
parameters.description: ID of the transaction to create a label for.

post.description: Remove a tag from a transaction. No effect if the transaction does not have the tag.

parameters.name: transaction-id
parameters.description: ID of the transaction to remove tag from.

post.summary: Set a list of tags to a transaction
post.description: Set the list of tags on a transaction. Remove all tags on the transaction that don't appear on the list. Add all tags on the transaction from the list.

parameters.name: transaction-id
parameters.description: ID of the transaction to set tags on.

post.description:
Create a new Workflow Run.

Note: The payload is arbitrary and defined by the Workflow version trigger schema.

data.description: Matches the trigger payload schema defined by the Workflow version

attributes.description: Matches the trigger payload schema defined by the workflow version

example-field-1.description: This is just an example field name. The actual name will depend on the trigger schema defined for the workflow version.

example-field-2.description: This is just an example field name. The actual name will depend on the trigger schema defined for the workflow version.

keyInflectionHeader.name: Key-Inflection
keyInflectionHeader.description: Determines casing for the API response

inquiry-template.description: Only present for Dynamic Flow inquiries

inquiry-template-version.description: Only present for Dynamic Flow inquiries

ExtractionResponses.description: A list of extractions resulting from processing the uploaded documents corresponding to the document's extraction configuration.

results.description: A list of objects containing the actual value extracted and additional information relevant to the extraction result.

page.description: The page number the extraction result is detected. Page is 1-indexed.

match-level.description: If extraction-type is guided, match-level describes the degree in which the extracted value is similar to the source value. Otherwise the match-level is full.

metadata.description: This is a free-form object containing potentially helpful metadata on the extraction result.

files.description: The files uploaded to the document for processing.

document-type.description: The classification of the document if detected. If unable to be detected, this will be other.

fields.description: JSON key-value pairs of field name to field value.

checks.description: A list of the processed verification checks.

reasons.description: If applicable, reasons are the list of reasons explaining why the check failed or is not applicable.

metadata.description: This is a free-form object containing relevant metadata to the processing and result of the check.

fields.description: JSON key-value pairs of field name to field value.

files.description: The files uploaded to the associated document for processing.

examples: Selected country code invalid selected country code of ZX

examples: resource already exists as an active resource
